titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Claire Lee Chennault Papers 1941-1967
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-11-10T11:52-0800

change.item: 10 November 2016: Revised after preservation consolidation of cardfile boxes, box 13/14 now all in 13 5 February 2015: Added photograph card file descriptions 5 July 2011: Declassified records series added; March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Claire Lee Chennault Papers)//EN" "chennauc.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 12 manuscript boxes, 1 card file box, 3 envelopes

did.abstract: Correspondence, orders, memoranda, reports, and speeches and writings, relating to aerial operations in China during World War II, and to postwar American foreign policy in China.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copiesof audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Claire Lee Chennault papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

chronitem.event: Commissioned First Lieutenant, U.S. Army. Became military aviator
Retired from U.S. Army Air Corps as a Lieutenant Colonel
Commanding Officer, American Volunteer Group in Chinese Air Force
Commissioned Brigadier General, U.S. Army Air Forces
Commanding General, China Air Task Force
Retired from U.S. Army Air Forces
President, Chinese National Reconstruction and Rehabilitation Air Transport, and its successor organizations, Civil Air Transport and China Air Transport

controlaccess.subject: World War, 1939-1945--Aerial operations.
World War, 1939-1945--China.
World War, 1939-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, orders, citations, and financial and flight records, relating to the military career of Claire Chennault, arranged alphabetically by form.

did.unittitle: Financial records. Vouchers, pay authorizations, correspondence, and miscellany,
CHINA. AIR FORCE. AMERICAN VOLUNTEER GROUP,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office file of Claire Chennault as Commanding Officer of the American Volunteer Group, August 1941-July 1942. Correspondence, memoranda, orders, and reports, arranged alphabetically by form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Papers of Claire Chennault after the end of World War II. Correspondence, speeches and writings, memoranda, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. and British governments. Includes some interfiled unclassified records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes U.S. Congress, China Defense Supplies, and General Motors Corporation material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Personnel cards for members of the American Volunteer Group, arranged alphabetically by form. China. Air Force. American Volunteer Group - Personnel

did.unittitle: Aerial photographs of the Kunming area of China taken by the U.S. 14th Air Force during World War II, August 1943. 3 prints.
Photographs of Claire Chennault depicting him in various locations in China and the United States, circa 1940-1948. 7 prints.
20 prints of Claire Lee Chennault, alone and with others, 1943-1945
